channel.title: Server. will. not. work. for anyone but me
channel.description:
So i have this server thats 317, im sure i have the info right but it just wont go online for anyone but me!
I can get on FINE with mopar, but nobody else can with the site or mopar.
http://tinypic.com/view.php?pic=30cp2s3&s=7 Thats what it loads for me on my webclient, after that part it just fails and says "Error Connecting to Server" for some reason. Other people it just goes straight to cant connect to server, retrying in x x being the number of seconds
Nobody else can even get on the mopar. What can i do :(

item.title: Server. will. not. work. for anyone but me
item.dc:creator: @VillainScape VillainScape
item.description:
@VillainScape wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:25, topic:390815”][quote author=VillainScape link=topic=486753.msg3568061#msg3568061 date=1302817124]

Portforward

I already portforwarded.

http://tinypic.com/view.php?pic=2nibcsx&s=7
[/quote]

Again, like I said. Just because the router config says that the port is open, doesn’t mean connections will reach your computer.

http://cmyip.com/

Go there, type in the port number, if it says error, it’s not open.[/quote]

I know, i know.
canyouseeme.org says that it could not reach the port because “the port refused”
Ugh! I keep trying to fix it but something else always goes wrong.

Read full topic
item.source: Server. will. not. work. for anyone but me

Portforward
[/quote]

I already portforwarded.

http://tinypic.com/view.php?pic=2nibcsx&s=7[/quote]

Again, like I said. Just because the router config says that the port is open, doesn’t mean connections will reach your computer.

http://cmyip.com/

Go there, type in the port number, if it says error, it’s not open.

item.title: Server. will. not. work. for anyone but me
item.dc:creator: @VillainScape VillainScape
item.description:
@VillainScape wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:21, topic:390815”][quote author=VillainScape link=topic=486753.msg3567468#msg3567468 date=1302759229]
Wtf? Error: I could not see your service on 69.116.49.102 on port (43594)
Reason: Connection timed out

It says that (minus the wtf)
I checked my firewall, the port is definitly open. I made two exceptions for that port just to make sure.
[/quote]

Obviously it’s not open. That tool was made by the same people who made No-IP. When I opened my ports, it told me so.
Some routers just don’t like it. Like a lot of linksys routers. And it could also be your ISP blocking it.[/quote]

I double checked. I made 2 exceptions in my firewall and another in my router. How can i fix the isp block?

Read full topic

item.title: Server. will. not. work. for anyone but me
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Nasz, post:18, topic:390815”][quote author=Fringe Division link=topic=486753.msg3567316#msg3567316 date=1302748251]
you need to open your port if you still need help i will team view you.
[/quote]

Look at the before pics, his ports are opened. :rolleyes:[/quote]

Just because his router says the ports are open, doesn’t mean that they are. Windows firewall could also be blocking connections at a local level.

http://canyouseeme.org/

If that says that your port is opened, then it’s a problem with the client.

Read full topic

item.source: Server. will. not. work. for anyone but me

item.title: Server. will. not. work. for anyone but me
item.dc:creator: @VillainScape VillainScape
item.description:
@VillainScape wrote:

[quote=“Nasz, post:15, topic:390815”]You can find your ipv4 ip by going too your Network and Sharing options, and clicking on your internet, then properties. But apparently your ipv4 is correctly set, (192.168.1.4),

Your server IP should be registered with no-ip. Put the no-ip within your client.

In your server, I think you have too put your ip in either:

Server.java
Main.java
or
Gui.java

After that, compile, etc. Try too get other people too connect, and make sure your firewall is either off, or accepting port 43594 or the application you named on your router for 43594 (VillainScape)[/quote]

Ill edit this post in a sec. I already put the server ip in all those files you mentioned, so i guess ill recheck my firewall and ipv4

my friend got this: http://i55.tinypic.com/vqru44.png

So i re-jarred and restarted server, now hes getting another connection error.

Read full topic
item.source: Server. will. not. work. for anyone but me

item.title: Server. will. not. work. for anyone but me
item.dc:creator: @Nasz Nasz
item.description:
@Nasz wrote:

You can find your ipv4 ip by going too your Network and Sharing options, and clicking on your internet, then properties. But apparently your ipv4 is correctly set, (192.168.1.4),

Your server IP should be registered with no-ip. Put the no-ip within your client.

In your server, I think you have too put your ip in either:

Server.java
Main.java
or
Gui.java

After that, compile, etc. Try too get other people too connect, and make sure your firewall is either off, or accepting port 43594 or the application you named on your router for 43594 (VillainScape)

Read full topic
item.source: Server. will. not. work. for anyone but me

item.title: Server. will. not. work. for anyone but me
item.dc:creator: @VillainScape VillainScape
item.description:
@VillainScape wrote:

Nasz:

Of course there is, did you make sure that the server ip is set too your Ip, and not your network ip?

Im confused. Whats the difference, and where can i find the ipv4 ip? is that my server ip from no-ip?

So many questions

I cant run ipconfig because it just closes on startup

Read full topic

item.source: Server. will. not. work. for anyone but me

item.title: Server. will. not. work. for anyone but me
item.dc:creator: @VillainScape VillainScape
item.description:
@VillainScape wrote:

[quote=“Nasz, post:8, topic:390815”][quote author=VillainScape link=topic=486753.msg3567119#msg3567119 date=1302738937]

You’re using wireless, lol, thx for including that on your reply, usually it’d be another after, yes, you have too portfoward. The webclient guide might of just expected you too have been portfowarded already.

On your browser, open a new tab and type in your Router Ip, (Usually it’s 192.168.1.1)

Go into the “applications and gaming” depending on the router you have, and try too include this information…

Name Port Port Type Network ip
rsps 43594 43594 TCP 192.168.1.(your ending)

Your network ip can be found within your Network and Sharing settings, click on the source you use for internet, and then click on properties, you would wanna use your ipv4 address. :rolleyes:

Grrr. Im trying to do it BUT IT WONT WORK.
http://tinypic.com/view.php?pic=vzufjn&s=7

Thats what i put in, and it wont work. Like it says the port is there but i still cant connect except for mopar and nobody else can connect from anywhere. Do i put my server ip somewhere? Cuz thats my computers IP
[/quote]

Not the computer ip, the network ip ;o.

Command Prompt, type ipconfig and it should show you a huge list of results, but if that’s your ipv4, make sure that it’s enabled, and that your router is accepting incoming connections.[/quote]

ipconfig closes as soon as it opens. I managed to catch a printscreen of it tho
http://tinypic.com/view.php?pic=2zegq5f&s=7

And thats all i could get

Read full topic

item.title: Server. will. not. work. for anyone but me
item.dc:creator: @Nasz Nasz
item.description:
@Nasz wrote:

[quote=“VillainScape, post:7, topic:390815”][quote author=Nasz link=topic=486753.msg3567085#msg3567085 date=1302736863]
You’re using wireless, lol, thx for including that on your reply, usually it’d be another after, yes, you have too portfoward. The webclient guide might of just expected you too have been portfowarded already.

On your browser, open a new tab and type in your Router Ip, (Usually it’s 192.168.1.1)

Go into the “applications and gaming” depending on the router you have, and try too include this information…

Name Port Port Type Network ip
rsps 43594 43594 TCP 192.168.1.(your ending)

Your network ip can be found within your Network and Sharing settings, click on the source you use for internet, and then click on properties, you would wanna use your ipv4 address. :rolleyes:
[/quote]

Grrr. Im trying to do it BUT IT WONT WORK.
http://tinypic.com/view.php?pic=vzufjn&s=7

Thats what i put in, and it wont work. Like it says the port is there but i still cant connect except for mopar and nobody else can connect from anywhere. Do i put my server ip somewhere? Cuz thats my computers IP[/quote]

Not the computer ip, the network ip ;o.

Command Prompt, type ipconfig and it should show you a huge list of results, but if that’s your ipv4, make sure that it’s enabled, and that your router is accepting incoming connections.

Read full topic
